you did do fdisk -l /dev/sda  not /dev/sda1 (common mistake)
windows7 for some reason installs often with a little bit of enpty hd at the front/rear of it. it also often installs with  windows own version of a boot partition.

you could pastebin your fdisk -l output --> 'sudo fdisk -l | pastebinit'
